body:
So this thread is to inform new people on how to kill farm.
So what maps do you like to kill farm and where do you actually do the kill farming?
body_tagged:
So this thread is to inform new people on how to kill farm.
So what maps do you like to kill farm and where do you actually do the kill farming?
title: Favorite map to kill farm/how?

replies.body:
Quintos 4 Sure...

In a big hole just under [whichever team im not on] pathway so they fall in and kf :P
replies.body_tagged:
Quintos 4 Sure...

In a big hole just under [whichever team im not on] pathway so they fall in and kf :P

replies.body: Maps such as Quintus and Luar, where I can snipe bridgers. On those 2 particular maps, I always have one particular spot that I stay at. Usually in the middle areas ahead of spawn, where the main fighting occurs.

replies.body:
Clay Wars. 

There is no overpowered iron armour, no special potions, it's pure PvP, and because it's such an underestimated map, lots of inexperienced players play on it, making it easy to knock players out of the world.

replies.body:
sure. you should see me killfarm on Clay Wars, lol. I can almost single-handedly lock down the entire side of the map because of it's style.All you do is hybrid blockhit and send everyone flying. eZ 20 killstreaks. Not saying how i set up barriers doe, but it gets to a point where they cant even get to their own monument area if I want to do that. Most of the time I choose not to though cuz that's a dick move tbh L: 

If you know how to killfarm Clay Wars you rack up HUGE points

replies.body: That's not a kill farm. A 20 kill streak is pretty easy on anymap if you play it right. When I say "killfarm" I'm talking about 120+ kill streaks, I'm not saying it's not possible to do on claywars but it is highly unlikely. With a map like Infernus you can easily achieve 100+ kill streaks within 15 minutes, that's a killfarm.

reply_to.body: clay wars with diamond armor= Best killfarm ever
reply_to.body_tagged: clay wars with diamond armor= Best killfarm ever

replies.body:
If you set it up correctly with teammates, 120+ killstreaks on Clay Wars are definately attainable for a single player with other contributors. If you're setting up the barriers correct you can kill 3 people at once, maybe 5 if you play it right, even with leather. 20+ (solo) usually, when done correctly is definately attainable. I get really high streaks if teammates help me set up the kf, even if they're randoms on Clay Wars because when you're low you run back and they can cover for you easily. I'm saying that people don't view it as one, but it can be. 

If you set up a wall behind you, you're completely fine.

I'm saying that people don't view it as one, but it can be.

replies.body: When saying a map is a "killfarm map" you have to take into consideration other factors. The monuments are incredibly easy to get on Clay Wars, making it not a good kill farm map. Also, you cannot get any better armour than leather, so you have absolutely no safety net if somebody starts to get a good combo on you. Saying Clay Wars is killfarm map is like saying Rendezvous is, you can get pretty high killstreaks, but you're not really "killfarming".
replies.body_tagged: When saying a map is a "killfarm map" you have to take into consideration other factors. The monuments are incredibly easy to get on Clay Wars, making it not a good kill farm map. Also, you cannot get any better armour than leather, so you have absolutely no safety net if somebody starts to get a good combo on you. Saying Clay Wars is killfarm map is like saying Rendezvous is, you can get pretty high killstreaks, but you're not really "killfarming".

replies.body: This isn't a "Kill Farm Map", Kill Farming is farming kills which makes your KDR go up, and results in a big amount of XP in return and boosted KDR, on Clay Wars you can get around the same amount of kills, but you can't "Farm" like on other maps like Quintus, since you usually die more often or commonly rather than an actual Kill Farming map with Strength Potions, Diamond Armor, etc.

reply_to.body:
Clay Wars. 

There is no overpowered iron armour, no special potions, it's pure PvP, and because it's such an underestimated map, lots of inexperienced players play on it, making it easy to knock players out of the world.
reply_to.body_tagged:
Clay Wars. 

There is no overpowered iron armour, no special potions, it's pure PvP, and because it's such an underestimated map, lots of inexperienced players play on it, making it easy to knock players out of the world.

replies.body:
What's the point of kill farming?


ps Not trying to be rude, genuine question.
replies.body_tagged:
What's the point of kill farming?


ps Not trying to be rude, genuine question.

replies.body:
To raise K/D and get huge xp amounts. Useful for leveling up. 
It's also funny seeing like 6 randies running at you, knocking like 3 or 4 of them out of the world and ending up getting a free Hexakill xD. That doesn't usually happen, but killfarming is more fun than you might think. I prefer to rush or play offence. I'll be playing offence more to practice the position now :P 

Also I'll be killfarming to level up, as I'm lvl 40+ on Nebula and Nexus (40 on Nebula, 41-42 on Nexus) and want prestige.

replies.body: Because I want to be maxed out in nebula, and monuments don't give that much xp. I don't really care about my KDR, I just try to play, but not to an extent where I want an overall high KDR.
